subject: Re: overriding a method executed in the constructor: dont't work.
msgSnippet: ... I *suspect* you ve got Eclipse s compiler compliance mode set to 1.4. I m using Eclipse 3.1 (not 3.1.1) and with the compliance mode set to 1.3 or 1.4, it
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Jeff Nielsen" <jeff.nielsen@d...> wrote:
> Overridden not overloaded, yes--it was a late night. The other
> error in my message is that you instantiate objects not
> classes--glad no one dinged me on that. :-)
>
> Just as a data point, I ran the OPs code in Eclipse 3.1.1 under
> jre1.5.0_05 and experienced the same test failure he had. So I'm
> not sure it's simply a Java 1.4 vs. Java 1.5 thing. Of course,
> Eclipse uses its own compiler . . .

I *suspect* you've got Eclipse's compiler compliance mode set to 1.4.
I'm using Eclipse 3.1 (not 3.1.1) and with the compliance mode set to
1.3 or 1.4, it fails. With the compliance mode set to 5.0, it passes.

Jon
